market_sentiment.summary: Gold is showing bullish momentum driven by USD weakness, Fed rate cut expectations, and tariff/geopolitical uncertainty, but some caution is warranted due to recent volatility and mixed technicals.

news_highlights.headline: Gold rose to 3,345.65 USD/t.oz on July 1, 2025, up 1.28% from the previous day
Gold price builds on recovery from $3,248-3,247 region gaining positive traction for second successive day
Concerns about worsening US fiscal conditions drag USD to lowest level since February 2022
Heightened uncertainty over Trump's tariff policies ahead of July 9 deadline benefits gold's safe-haven status
Trump steps up pressure campaign on Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell to lower borrowing costs
Markets pricing in 74% probability of Fed rate cut as soon as September
Gold price takes a beating on ceasefire news falling more than $50 an ounce
Gold Slips to $3,298 as Ceasefire & Dollar Strength Trigger selling pressure
Global gold ETF flows remained positive in 2025 at US$30bn despite May outflows
Central banks doubled annual gold purchases from 500 to over 1,000 metric tonnes since Russia-Ukraine war
Gold rises on weaker dollar, tariff uncertainty before deadline
Gold rebounds from over one-month low on weaker dollar
Gold set for second weekly loss; US inflation data in focus

forecast_scenarios.short: Upside potential to $3,400 if strength persists above $3,370; monitor for volatility around U.S. data and Fed signals.
forecast_scenarios.medium: Range-bound between $3,250 and $3,400 as market digests Fed policy and tariff outcomes.
forecast_scenarios.long: Sustained institutional buying and central bank demand could support higher prices, but risks remain from easing geopolitical tensions and changing Fed stance.

final_decision.reasoning: Consensus is moderately bullish: both sources cite USD weakness, Fed rate cut expectations, and tariff/geopolitical uncertainty as supportive. Technicals are mixed but lean bullish, and institutional flows remain positive. However, recent volatility and potential for reversal warrant some caution.
